simplextree 0.7.1

  • Reference

Simplex Tree

simplex_tree.Rd

Simplex tree class exposed as an Rcpp Module.

simplex_tree()

Value

A queryable simplex tree, as a Rcpp_SimplexTree object (Rcpp module).

Details

A simplex tree is an ordered trie-like structure specialized for storing and doing general computation simplicial complexes. Here is figure of a simplex tree, taken from the original paper (see 1):

The current implementation provides a limited API and a subset of the functionality described in the paper.

Fields

n_simplices

A vector, where each index k denotes the number (k-1)-simplices.

max_depth

The maximum height of the tree. The root of the tree has height 0, vertices have height 1, etc.

Methods

$print_tree

Prints the simplex tree.

$apply()

Applies a function to a subset of the simplex tree.

$insert_simplex

Inserts a simplex into the trie, if it doesn't exist.

$remove_simplex

Removes a simplex from the trie, if it exists.

$find_simplex

Searches the trie for a simplex.

$collapse

Performs an elementary collapse.

$contract

Performs an edge contraction.

$is_face

Checks for faces.

$serialize

Serializes the simplex tree.

$deserialize

Unserializes a stored simplex tree.

$as_list

Converts the complex to a list.

$as_adjacency_matrix

Converts the 1-skeleton to an adjacency matrix.

$as_adjacency_list

Converts the 1-skeleton to an adjacenecy list.

$as_edgelist

Converts the 1-skeleton to an edgelist.

References

1. Boissonnat, Jean-Daniel, and Clement Maria. "The simplex tree: An efficient data structure for general simplicial complexes." Algorithmica 70.3 (2014): 406-427.

Examples

## Recreating simplex tree from figure. 
stree <- simplex_tree()
stree$insert_simplex(c(1, 2, 3))
stree$insert_simplex(c(2, 3, 4, 5))
stree$insert_simplex(c(5, 6, 9))
stree$insert_simplex(c(7, 8))
stree$insert_simplex(10)
